data.text: This App is completely unusable. Once you get to the create password section, it won't allow me to type in a password. My keyboard completely disappears and it looks like it's glitching out. I've uninstalled and reinstalled it multiple times, annnnd restarted my phone. Still won't work. I tried doing the "copy and paste trick" that I read on another review but no luck. I'm beyond frustrated!

It's hit or miss with this app. I get error messages when trying to send people money, can't find them even though they're in my contacts, and they can't find me. I just had to send requests to friends for payments they were trying to send me.....we'll see if that works. Sometimes, the app works for me ,sometimes, it doesn't. Frustrating!

I can anymore with zelle, why does it work only on and off. I love zelle, but if I don't use it on a regular basis, it doesn't function for whatever reason. I just checked to see if there was a new update that I needed, but no doesnt show one. It has me logged out, but I can click the sign in button. Everytine it seems like I will have to Uninstaller and re install, which makes you lose all previous zelle history and contacts. Zelle you need to get it together

At first I experienced the password issue like everyone else. I solved that issue by typing my password and then copying to the clipboard. I then went back to the zelle app and would hold down on the word password. Slide your finger up just a little bit and the option to paste from clipboard stays available and you can enter your password, thus completing setup.

Less than 1 star. The app won't scan my debit card. It moves the cursor to the beginning after typing first character in many of the fields. It won't keep the keyboard up while trying to enter a password and now is throwing errors when trying to log back in. How does anyone trust this app? Complete garbage!!!

This application is completely unusable. Upon accessing the "Create Password" section, I am unable to enter a password. My keyboard disappears and appears as if it's displaying an error. Multiple re-installations and restarts have been attempted, yet the issue persists. Despite reading other reviews that suggest attempting the "copy and paste trick", no success has been achieved. The frustration escalates further when I find myself beyond frustrated!

I've tried to create an account with Zelle for a long time now. I have the Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra. Nothing is wrong with my phone, all updates are completed, etc. I've uninstalled and reinstalled this app with zero luck. I'm having the exact same keyboard issue with the password upon login. Super frustrating.

Able to download app, however unable to create account. Get as far as trying to set up password, then it freezes and doesn't allow to type password to go forward. Tried contacting support. They are unable to help me, just said to wait a day or two and try again. I guess I will just have to use different app.

Once upon a time this was a good app. Now it's horrible. First I couldn't send a payment because the payee was a "business", whatever that means. Then I don't use the app for about a year. I re-enroll because my previous card was already expired. I enter the new info and it gives me a random error and asks me to try again. After three tries, I gave up. Uninstalled.

Six months ago, I would have given it 5 stars, but it's become almost unusable. Like others, I had issues getting past the login screen. When trying to enter my number, touching the screen in an attempt to get the keypad to come up would make the page flash, but do nothing else. I had to reinstall the whole app just to be able to use it, had to reset permissions, re-enter some of my card info, etc. I NEVER had this kind of issue before. Will be looking for a new money transfer app ASAP!

Can't even use the app. I put in the ZIP code for the town I live in, and it gives me a town hundreds of miles away. Obviously, my bank has the proper info, so there is an error if I leave the (wrong) town info... But changing to the correct town also throws an error. It's completely useless. I mean, seriously, this app is absolute garbage if it can't even get a city matched with its ZIP code... I've never heard of Red Top... But a Google map search shows it's nowhere near the bay area... ü§¶üèª‚Äç

I can't even pass the login page! I tried updating it, uninstalling, and re-installing the app, but nothing. When I try to log in, it loads for a second and then freezes. This is frustrating. A little note: if yall call a number to get help from zelle, and they are asking you to install an app so they can help, DONT! It's a scam! They are trying to get full access to your phone. Make sure when you call, it's an AI talking to you.

Has a WEEKLY send limit of $500. Plus the app doesn't admit that it won't let you sign up without allowing the app to always track your location. It makes it seem like an option, asking over and over during sign-up. And if you consistently decline, at the very end, for some mysterious reason, there will be an unexpected problem and you won't able to create an account.

I can't finish setting up my account! It will not let me enter a password. It just flashes something quickly on-screen, but the keyboard will not come up. I came here to the app page hoping to find a solution only to find out this has been happening for months with no response from Zelle. This app is absolute rubbish, and I would highly recommend avoiding it until they can properly address this critical bug and respond to users!

UPDATE: Zelle was working just fine until I decided to switch cards. "Switch Account" didn't work, so I deleted my profile, updated the app, tried to sign up again, but couldn't get any further than the address page. All I get is "uh-oh, there was a problem. Try again." Now it's completely unusable. Old review: It's convenient and easy to use. üëçüèæ The only thing I'd knock it for is the $500 sending limit on the Zelle app. üëéüèæ

I downloaded Zelle to make sure I had payment options for my new apartment. I tried to set up an account multiple times with my two debit cards, but each time there was a problem. What exactly the problem was, was never specified, but eventually my account was permanently locked before I ever had the chance to use it. When I called support to get it taken care of, the machine told me that the office was currently closed and hung up without telling me when they opened.

Just random delays with no head up or information as a recipient. It's pretty frustrating when you are talking to someone and have had multiple transactions with them, and the money is taken from their account but not sent to me nor notifying me of any pending transaction. The money is just in limbo and we just have to wait for zelle to follow thru... eventually. Too unreliable. I'd would be fine with delays if they just informed you directly in the app instead of needing to call support

About a year ago Zelle worked for me fine. Now it asks for my mobile number, and I tap to bring up the number keypad and enter that number. But, the keypad flashes for less than one second, then disappears. At the moment Zelle is completely useless. My experience seems to be much like David Culbreth's, except that my account is already set up. I hope this gets fixed soon.

For those having the password issue, try this. Type the new password in a text message and then copy to your clipboard. Then tap on the password field and the Paste option shows up (but quickly disappears). Keep tapping on the field and try to click Paste before it disappears. It took my 5 or 6 tries but it eventually worked and now my Zelle account is active. We shouldn't have to go through these hoops to use the app,.

Got a new debit card, only thing that changed was the expiration date and code on the back. Absolutely no way to update it, switch account or delete and re-create my account, all get "Uh oh" with absolutely no way to fix it. Customer support says they don't support debit cards from my bank...when I literally made a payment with the old card yesterday. I call BS. Fix your app.

It was a bit of hassle setting up the account as my credit union is not supported, but I was able to make transactions with my debit card. Then, one day, I was told the app needed to be updated, but the Play Store said my device is not supported. The unsupported device is a four year old android phone. I would suggest not trying up any money in the app unless your bank is supported, as you may at some point need to buy a new phone to access your account.

I am here to inform you that in my experience, after multiple exhausting hundreds of attempts, Zelle service does not work in any way, shape, or form. It simply does not work. There are no clear workable directions or guidance. It is an utter failure on every level. With that said, had there been clear guidance, a user would know whether or not there was an issue on the user end. Zelle is lacking in guidance or functionality. I find the system useless and dysfunctional. Zelle is the worst!

I see the issue I am having other people are having too. That issue being not being able to enter a password to complete the setup. I figured if I checked the reviews that maybe an administrator or someone would reply and advise how to resolve the problem, but NOPE not a word. There is noone to email to get assistance this is just totally and completely useless. UGH!!! Guess I will have to get something different

So far, so frustrating. It kept saying "uh oh an error occurred" when trying to add my debit card, but not direction as to what happened or how to fix it. Finally got it to work (no clue how though) and then it kept glitching when I tried to create a password for my acct. The keyboard won't stay up longer than 1/2 a second to create one. So...what am I supposed to do now??

Can't use this app... couple problems, entering the CC expiration date is backwards when you enter it in month then year... it swaps it to YY/MM... you have to out smart it to get it in right format. Also, you can't enter password as all the other reviews mentioned. So you can't even set up your account... what a joke for an app, how can you trust Zelle with security if they can't even get those basic things right.

I'd rate zero stars if I could. I can't even get past the initial setup screen asking for a Mobile Number. When I tap that, it flashes something quickly, but never shows the keyboard. If I fuss with long presses, it will sometimes show me a menu with Paste, Clip and Autofill, but none of those accomplishes anything useful. So I can't use this app at all. Running Android 10, latest available for my LG G7.

When trying to create an account, I entered all of my contact and debit card information, but at the final step when it asks to create a password, the app freaked out and refused to let me type anything in the password text field. Wouldn't pull up the keyboard, nor would it let me paste any text. Tried closing and reopening the app, but to no avail. Might rate it higher if I could get far enough to create a password and even try using it!!

This app is is useful and good. I appreciate the level of security that it has. But it really annoying that I have been trying to add a new divise and deleting the old one. It's turning out in mission impossible. User should have a simple way to do this on the app settings. It's totally disappointing since is delaying payment because the system is sensing discrepancy info.

Great and convenient payment option! A little difficult to set up if your bank is not on the list but once done it is really the perfect way to pay someone in a fast and efficient way. Another issue to note is that if you install VPN on your phone (and you should consider it) you will have to delete and reinstall Zelle, as it will not connect with the Internet otherwise.

1st off, the personnel suck. On the rare event when you DO get through. The app is irrelevant. It does nothing, & you're screwed if it just so happens that you have a bank that uses this platform, and you want to move your money to a 3rd party entity (for example if you have a savings account with no debit card and you want to transfer money from that savings to your PayPal.) 2 weeks I tried customer service and not once did they think to tell me they don't x-Fer to PayPal. Its a joke.

Cant make a Zelle account due to a screen prompt with a faulty flash bug. The Main screen asks you to input your number/ login but before you can press anything, a flash screen pop up for a second then disappears. Its a constant loop unless you hit sign up, then you can write your number for a bit before it malfunctions and goes haywire again. Fix the bug so i can make an account please. Thank you! (Its probably an issue with your code involving the keyboard and main menu. Id look there.)

This is ridiculous....I've been trying to create an account, but every time I go to enter a password, the screen flashes and will not pull the keyboard up to type in a password. It doesn't even pause long enough to paste anything. What's really messed up is that our bank suggested we use this app to transfer money to our account, but our bank isn't recognized on the app. Guess I'll stick with more reliable apps!

Couldn't even let me create a password, tapped on where to create one and the app would click out of it before I could do anything. Tried updating then uninstalling and reinstalling. Still same issue literally the one problem can't even let me use the app for its intended purpose. Tried seeing if there's desktop setup but it's purely for mobile so yeah.

When first installed, it worked great. After a phone software update, it wouldn't recognize my account. Uninstalled and reinstalled, set up my account fine right up until it asked for a new password. I can't get the keyboard to appear, and whatever is flashing on screen is so fast I can't read it. A glitch that needs repair? I have a $500 payment in limbo because of this glitch! FIX IT, PLEASE!!

** updated to 1 star. I've had issues adding recipients and making payments and have spent hours trying to resolve them. ** My bank is not a Zelle partner, so I can only send $500 a day. That is too limiting. The app is very bare bones, which makes it easy to use. I do wish there was a way to make the user more confident that the money is being sent to the expected recipient. I do like that the money is received by the recipient immediately.

This app isn't secure on your phone. If someone gets my phone they can access app and send money to anyone's number they enter. It's says it requires a thumbprint in options to be turned on. Its on but to this very date has never asked for print or verification or authentication. My other credit card apps automatically require my thumbprint before it ever opens. This is very risky when they are connected to your bank account and tech support can't answer the question as to why it doesn't work.

I never write app reviews. Ever. This is my first one. I can't even sign in, the interface is trash on Android. Literally no keyboard appears to sign in, it's a screen with unclickable buttons when before it worked just fine. Your time is better spent on another app cuz this ain't it. I'm STILL trying to get my money. You would think this would have an online option in case things like this happen but they seem to be so focused on cornering the app market, this is your only way to access money.

It's a sluggish, ugly app with poor error messages. Worst of all, it demands access to your entire contacts list, as there is NO OTHER WAY to specify the person with whom you're transacting. This whole system seems like a front for gathering information on people. Indeed, the terms of service say that the app employs a "third-party" tool to scan your device for malware, you know, to keep you safe, or something; I'm not even sure how that's possible, because this app doesn't seem to request access

The entire experience with setting up was horrible. I installed the app, fine. I opened it and put in my info.. my bank wasn't even an option..whatever. I confirm through my email, cool. Then I have to reconfirm through text?..okay.. But it didn't send me a code.. I waited and waited.. tried getting it to resend..nothing. I backed out of the app and retried setting up and THEN I get a text with a code. Now my account is locked and I can't get through. Ridiculous. Can't even use.

This app WILL allow you to transfer money, albeit with very annoying issues. It only allows one transfer daily. Secondly, it allows you to immediately send money anywhere to anyone; WITHOUT password verification. Despite multiple calls, customer service has been unable to resolve this matter, always instructing me to delete and reinstall the app (though the problem persists). The last Brainiac even accused my Android phone of causing the zelle app to bypass security protocols. Unbelievable!!!

This app is the worst thing I've ever tried to use, and it still doesn't work. Issues trying to do anything with a bank that isn't on their main list, seemingly have to use a debit card now, account setup issues, repeatedly must get verification codes, won't recognize my email address even though it's the same email they send the verification codes to, etc... My bank tells me I'll get my money put back into my account in 14 days since I can't claim it. We'll see. My Hope's are not high...

Update: still garbage!! Someone requested payment through here and I figured they'd have worked the issues out. Nope! Doesnt tell you this upfront but you can't pay businesses with a debit card. And they don't work with our bank. Still completely useless. Completely useless. Trying to sign up just gives an error that says There was an issue. Very helpful message. So many apps get electronic payment right, this one doesn't.

Been using this app for a while. I don't like that it gives a $500/wk limit to send money to an individual, & since my debit card needed updating, it erases the transaction history associated with the previous card (even though all that changed was the expiration date & the ID on the back). Now, I'm getting an error message, & can't log back in?!? Just installed the latest update, & STILL getting the error message when trying to sign in!

You can send someone money from your debit card or bank account using their phone number or email. Unfortunately, it doesn't tell you who you're sending it to until after you confirm send. I sent cash from my account to a number hoping and praying I typed it in correctly. I would like to see a name with the number before hitting send. It does show in the activity who you sent it to, but that was after the unsettling "you cannot cancel this transaction once you hit send" notification. I'm deleting the app. It served its purpose but I won't be using it again. Venmo, the cash app, and paypal are better options for me.

Unable to type numbers when trying to sign up. My husband was able to use a number keypad inside the app to get started but mine just acts unresponsive. No numbers pop up at all. The links at the bottom of the screen are unresponsive to touch as well. I tried installing, uninstalling, and reinstalling 3x. My husband's phone is identical to mine and we are using the same service. We tried setting up Zelle at the same time. I have permissions for phone and location granted & still doesn't work.

TRASH. STAY AWAY!!! After many attempts to send money, I keep getting the same error message over and over again. "Unable to process transaction.A101" Its NOT a bank issue. I restarted my phone. Uninstalling the app and reinstalling does nothing. Support is a joke. When the app wants to work it works, and when it doesn't it doesn't. VERY frustrating as I need to use this often, and often, the error message comes up. So annoying. Switching to something that works. STAY AWAY

It technically works. It's not the best app and it has many shortcomings but at least it's a safe and secure way to send money instantly. My girlfriend and I switched to zelle exclusively from venmo and it pales when you compare the features. For instance you can add a memo on your end but the person on the other side will not be able to see what the charge is for. This seems like a massive oversight as the memo is one of the most important pieces of a transfer.

Update: The issue's been fixed and the app works like it should. I actually love this app, but a recent issue makes it unusable. I tried to send money like I have in the past, and it starts sending, then says "logged out because of inactivity" and the transaction doesn't go through. I definitely haven't been inactive in that session, as I just hit the send button 2 seconds prior. This is clearly a bug that needs to be fixed. Until it is, I will have to find another way to send money like this.

Worked great for several months and then it wouldn't send the money. Kept logging me out when I pressed "Send". After uninstalled & reinstalled, will only send money without notation. A bummer for records. Makes paying easy for people who want cash. If you don't use it for several months, you might have to sign up again and you lose the records from the old account. Got notes back. Worked fine for another year. Now same problem.

When I first used zelle it was awesome for like 3 straight months. The last few months have been a nightmare though. I always get an error when I'm trying to send money or it crashes, the same thing when someone tries to send me money. I don't know what happened but this app has completely dropped the ball. I have to resort to the cash app just to send money, you have to pay a fee, but if rather do that then use this app. This app was great, free to send or receive money, now it's the worst out. The low rating truly tells the horrible experiences with it. STAY AWAY!!

Tried 3 times to put in my info when signing up and ran into the same error each time after continually agreeing to the same (sometimes odd) agreements that i was forced to agree to in order to sign up (such as allowing the app to make phone calls from my phone). Based on my experience and the massive amount of recent 1 star reviews that people are leaving for a variety of reasons, it appears this app is going down the toilet. I just deleted this app and won't ever be re downloading it again

Clunky, slow, inconvenient. It has to "think" every time I try to make a change, most of which don't even go through because it times out and reverts back. Super obnoxious to have to hit "sign in" every time I open the app. The sign-in screen should be the default. Sign-in process is outdated and slow. There should be other options for quick sign in than just fingerprint.

The app itself is fine, but when I ran into some issues with it recognizing my card's info (which was frustrating in itself because all was entered correctly), the customer service I received was very poor. Definitely among the worst customer service experiences I've had. I'd explain further but I'm still too frustrated. And, they kept referring to other card numbers that weren't mine, which makes me question how secure our info is with them. I don't trust them anymore.

Absolutely terrible experience. I can't get into my account since I switched phone carriers and, because of that, they supposedly can no longer verify my information. I even offered to answer questions to verify my identity and they said that wasn't an option because they "do everything electronically". Their only solution was for me to open a whole new bank account with one of their partner institutions. Terrible app, terrible customer service, terrible product. Send money another way. 0 *

whoever designed this app needs to go back to school. from installation to usage, is a disaster. just an example of something that should be simple and straighforward. when signing in, it sends a code to your email. The app does not allow to multi task so when you open your email to read the code and come back to the app it resets the whole process and sends a different code every time.

I was able to use for three successful transfers. As of May 1st 2020 the app will not load. It is in the same phone with all correct information. The absolutely will not open in the phone. My only guess is the phone has been upgraded to Android 10 it may not be compatible. Uninstall and restart is unsuccessful. No other apps on the phone have this issue.

So far i really like the program. No fee's or percentage payments. Some people don't like the 2 step verification's it uses frequently. I however think it's good to have, especially with an app that deals with finance's. There haven't been any issues I've come across personally but have had a couple friends experiencing problems. One other thing that I've noticed is that more and more banks and credit unions have been intigrating Zelle too, so the app isn't needed when sending money.

I used the app twice - first time for $1as a test transaction, then a real transfer. That was a few months ago. Now, I can't remember the password but when I click forgot password it keeps telling me incorrect password. We'll, duh! So, because I kept trying varying iterations I'm locked out. After reading so many negative reviews I better cut my losses and not bother.

Could not send money. Tried 4 times! Customer service is close to impossible to get ahold of! Their autovoice navigating options are confusing and I couldn't get to the right place no matter how many different options I tried. Even tried requesting an email response by sending them a message on their website: did not hear back from them (even checked my spam folder). They were completely unreachable for me. The only reason why I gave them any stars is because they used to work in the past.

Pathetic experience. I have TWO bank accounts, one they partner with, one not. Couldn't connect either one of them. Called assistance, took FOREVER to finally speak to someone and they tell me my account info doesn't match. Nope. I'm looking at it right now. It's fine. I've registered other financial link (like mint) just fine. Essentially, they're inept. Actively avoiding in the future. Stick with PayPal and venmo and checks. I would have gotten the money faster if I'd been MAILED a check.

The Zelle app itself is pretty terrible. I caynt do basic things like see more details of my transaction history, change my profile photo from existing photos (force closes), and recently had to reinstall and change my password. Each log in attempt, at the point of verifying my phone number, turned the screen partially black and was insanely glitchy looking. Not sure why this is a contender against other apps that provide similar services, with much more user-friendly interfaces.

Unusable. Update your card and then the app refuses to allow you to log back in. Just more trash in a world of trashy apps you need in order to live. Great. Of course, the error is described as "an error." "An error has occured." Gee, thanks! Glad you could clear that up for me! See, I thought it was working when the login screen froze and turned red, but the super helpful "an error occured" message cleared things up in a jiffy.

I had previously posted that I love the app except for having to reenter my recipient every time. I wish I would just save it and let me choose it again. Now, after more than 3 months, it won't let me send unless I allow it to access my contacts. That's not happening. Ever. I emailed to see if there was a way around it, but I never heard back. I'm deleting the app, but if I learn that their grab for my contacts is no longer mandatory, I will definitely install it again.

Works ok once it is setup. I was not able to setup my checking account with my debit card, until i was. Not very consistent setup process. I don't want to give it access to my contacts; I don't know if this information is used outside of my phone. I input the recipient's email or phone number they have associated with Zelle, but the app gives no feedback before or after sending the money about the recipient's name. It also doesn't remember your transactions.

I rarely send money through Zelle, just receive it, so I don't login into the app very often. Recently my debit card was replaced, so I opened the app to enter the new one. The app is completely frozen once I get to the sign-in page. I can't sign in, and if I tap on privacy policies or terms of use, nothing happens. I've restarted my phone, and uninstalled, then installed the app again, but it still isn't working. Unfortunately, it seems that you can't use Zelle through the website.

*updated review: the app updated and now I can't log in. Beyond inconvenient* So easy. I haven't had any issues with sending or receiving money. I haven't personally had to cancel a transaction, but a coworker did when she sent the wrong person money. It was easy to cancel and fix. I've had the app for about six months now and love it!

Garbage. GOOD LUCK if you have a new card and need to change your email on file. This app is pretty new and pretty terrible. Support is slow, and the options for changing your info is incredibly limited. If you have a new email address, you need a password to change it in the app. If you forgot your password (write it down!!!), they require the cvv of the card on file to reset it. If your card has changed since, and you do not have the cvv of the old card on file, then you must call support. Support is not responsive in a quick manner, and any transactions you may have been sent to your new email will be lost. As a struggling student, this is the most frustrating experience I've had with a money-sharing app. I would not say this is a reliable way to exchange transactions.

Frustrating. The app tells me I need to update my bank card with the new expiration date, but that is actually not an option? Instead, I must "Switch Accounts," which will result in the loss of transaction history connected to the previous card. This is highly inconvenient. Also, I dislike that I need neither a password nor a fingerprint to log in.

Zelle has been a total nightmare! It continues to lock me out where i have to call and sit on hold. Customer service is fine, its the app that is so sensative. They need to put three or two chances for a password. One slip of the keyboard and you are locked out, and your account is frozen. Then back to calling them, i understand security, but when you can't get into your account that's just wrong. I absolutely hate this app, use Venmo or cash app, way less of a hassle.

Excessive signup problems coupled with vague error codes that describe nothing. Due to multiple sign-up attempts, and various problems throughout the process my account was flagged for one reason or another. Now I have an account that's activated, with an email that I can't use. Support was able to tell me to try again later, but they couldn't tell me if I needed to try in a day, an hour, a month, or a year... Looks like they're still figuring this out.

Worst money app ive ever used in my life. Irritating af. Nothing is simple. I get a notification that someone has sent me money so I open the link and set it up to connect with my bank and then it just goes to my main bank screen and I don't see the money. No way to figure out where it went. Don't bother with this garbage app. Supposed to make digital payments easier but only makes it more difficult. Would have been easier mailing a check.

The app's function of sending money person to person has done its job. The interface is very direct, "send" or "request." I wish the transaction list posted the date of when it happened and not how long ago it happened. I like that the money goes from bank to bank, at least that's how I perceive it. I've read security issues from the media but I haven't encountered any. So hopefully, they continue to work on improving the security. Overall, it's been a good experience. Keep it up Zelle!!

It's been useful, but I've just encountered an issue. Sent money to a friend I've done many times. This latest one isnt. And the point is its supposed to be instant. WhennI click to confirm cancel, nothing happens. We tried with him doing a request and now stuck with 2 pendings. If this is gonna happen. I may as well use Paypal for instant transfers because at least its RELIABLE.

Beware! "Bank not listed? No problem! Download the app!" sometimes means that your bank wholly doesn't work with Zelle. If that's the case, prepare to spend precious time trying to add a debit card, getting useless error messages, getting locked out of the app with more useless error messages, and finally calling customer service only to find out that your debit card is "incompatible" with Zelle, which means you'll never be able to use the app even though the advertising says you could.

Seems to work ok, but the UI feels VERY minimal and there are some weird rules. I can send to some people, but not others. Even if someone sends me money, they don't show up as a recent contact so I could send back to them. I also can't see what email or phone number sent to me, so I have to guess which one they used. In it's current state, it feels like I have to call someone, setup a transaction with them and then confirm they received it. Could be much better!

This is the third time I've tried over the past year and a half to sign up and every time without fail it directs me to page where it asks for my mobile number, I enter it and a red notification of up telling me error occurred to again later. Of course no customer service to find out what did could be. So I've never been past that part. Tried on multiple devices as well. Same thing. Really frustrating.

Installed the app, followed the directions, confirmed both my cellphone number and my email address. Got an error message every time I tried to send money, using both the recipient's phone number and their email address (both confirmed to be correct, as the app confirmed their name) Reinstalled the app, restarted my phone, tried both my wifi network and my cellular data network. I don‚Äôt like that an app which has so much of my personal information failed at the first hurdle. Worse than useless.

Not sure if I have an account with Zelle at this point. I've attempted to use Zelle multiple times throughout 2 years, but I could never set it up without errors occurring. I've attempted it again today, and guess what happened? An error occurred! An error occurred when I tried logging in and an occurred when I tried setting up an account. This app doesn't want to work at all.

Opening app to sign in, will go through initial screen asking for permissions but when I try to sign in is unresponsive completely. It sits with a blinking cursor and can't bring up keyboard, can't press terms of use or privacy policy buttons, can't paste anything in, nothing. Hitting back button closes app, killing app and restarting does nothing, just gets back to same screen. Even uninstalling and reinstalling didn't work.

I am an IT professional. Signing up for this without a bank should not require calling into your support line to set up an account. I had to twice. I had to go to level two support each time. Support was polite but a waste of an hour trying to sign up for the app. Where do I send my bill for the hour of time wasted. I hope the money I am getting goes smoother than the setup. Also, it makes no sense that I had turn off WiFi and use my cell phone data for registration.

Trash. Can't use the app. Every time I try to sign in it glitches out and then I can do nothing with it. On the off-chance I'm finally able to get past the sign-in screen, the app breaks whenever I try to add my debit card. I don't use a big corporate bank so I can't even use the website online. From what I can tell, Zelle has A LOT of issues currently that need some good elbow grease.

So they fixed the earlier issue (below), but created a NEW ANNOYING problem to replace it. App won't start unless you click a button, once you do, it crashes. No change on re-installing. App worked fine for awhile on my Android phone, then suddenly stopped showing a full number pad and would only show 1 2 3. Uninstalling and re-installing the app along with new password DID NOT HELP, screen still only shows 1 2 3 and not a full keypad. App is now basically useless, would not recommend.

It's a very basic, straightforward app, with clear and easy directions to sign up/use. I think it would be nice to have the option to add more than one card/account to transfer your funds into. But it's understandable why you can't. This way you don't have to login to transfer funds sent to you through Zelle, it just automatically goes into to the attached bank account. I haven't had any issues with the app, or the service itself. Thank you for providing this nice service, and for free at that.

Probably one of the most confusing app ever. I have it in my bank app, but can't retrieve money so I signed up using this app, which then doesn't let me add profile photo nor allow me to enable email, with terrible error message that tells you nothing. Poor integration, poor UI... basically a bad desperate system trying to do too much and does nothing right.

The app gladly accepts your banking information but there's no way for you to remove your account through the app. They keep your information so beware of this.  Their system is also very very slow. Upon signing up I had to wait almost 15 mins to receive an email verification which is unacceptable by today's standards.  There is also no mention to why a card can't be linked. After some time digging around their website, come to find out they don't support business debit cards. Proper error messages go a long long way.

Terrible security. I log out of the app, but logging back in does not require any credentials, other than the phone number which is filled in automatically. I have set it to ask for a thumbprint (lame that is the only option, no pin) but it doesn't ask for it. One click access to my bank account, how convenient for someone who has managed to get into my phone! My bank is not one of the few that have zelle, so it appears the phone app is my only option.

Awful. It limits how much I can send each day, there are constant system errors, I've been locked out of my account several times and it has never once worked for me. It can't find people based on phone number or email and when I enter the info manually it tells me to try again later or contact customer service. I have no idea how anyone is able to use Zelle successfully, it's been completely useless for me.

Used it for a long time. Absolutely loved it. I had to get a new debit card and tried to set it up. Every day, it just tells me there's an error and to try again later. I even checked with my bank to see if all my info was correct. I checked on their website to see if I was doing something wrong or how to contact customer service but all I found was it essentially telling me to contact my bank. It's not a card issue, it's the app's issue. I guess I have to find another money sending app.

worst app ever. when you are told to get code sent via text the app switches back to the beginning of the process when you switch back to their app. not possible to complete their process and forcefully unable to open the account on the same device that they send text messages. programming skillset is low grade and backwards thinking technical team at Zelle.

Great app, the only complaint I have is that there's a weekly limit to how much you can transfer and they don't tell you how much that is ($500) or when it resets (Sunday). I had to go digging and searching on my own figure it out. I use it primarily to transfer funds between my own personal bank accounts for budgeting purposes. My credit union doesn't partner with zelle so I have limits to what I can send- which made paying rent tricky. Otherwise, it's quick and functions pretty well.

Useless. For some reason, Well Fargo choose this poor service over a working solution for transfers to my credit union. I've had my account with that CU for over 30 years. The app didn't support my last phone or current tablet, so I couldn't even install the app until a phone upgrade. Finally got it installed but it still doesn't support my CU. Tried to enter my debit card info, both before and after getting a new card. Failed with unsupported card first time, unspecified error on second try. What a POS and frustrating waste of time!

I installed the app, allowed the permissions, and started the enrollment setup. I put in my phone number and a big red box appears that says "an error has occurred", but it doesn't say what the error is, and I can't get past it. I double checked the app permissions, cleared the data and started over, and I still get the same big red box, with no clue as to how to fix the issue. Dumping. I'll keep using my other cash apps.

Not a fan of this app. Click on text to get security code to register, then it takes you right back to the main screen to enter info all over again only to have to click off again to get security code which leads right back to the same problem. Can't open on computer because it's indicating it's already downloaded on my phone. An app is no good if you can't use it. Hands down review all the way.

Literally sucks. I have tried multiple different times to connect my bank. My bank comes up in the list, and I click it and nothing happens. I thought there must be an update so I updated it. Still no. I uninstalled and reinstalled it.. Still no. And I have done this a few times throughout the past year or so. It never works. So many other apps out there to use.

My experience setting up this app was rather difficult..unlike the CashApp. Once I was prompted to enter a verification code..(minimizing the screen to retrieve code from email..) going back to the ZELLE app..I had to start the process over each time which Yet getting basically sent me in circles! I got no where!! Only to the screen where I had to enter the verification code...üò°üò°üò°üò°

Completely useless if you use a bank outside of their network. They claim you can connect with a debit card, but any attempt at that just gives errors, and eventually locks your account entirely. I contacted their support and they claimed nothing was wrong and told me to try again. And, no surprise, it still didn't work. Go with something reliable like Venmo, this app is complete garbage.

The service itself is fine.  The problem is with the application itself.  I registered on Zelle with my spam email address because I only use my preferred email address with business contacts.  Well, the sender sent the payment to my preferred email address so I was unable to receive it.  I tried adding my preferred email address as a secondary email account but the application kept giving me an error "Unable to register email".  It turns out that this is a problem with the app and the solution is to have the sender cancel the payment and resend it to the registered email account.  This should be a simple problem to fix.  It certainly makes one wonder if they have this problem, what other more serious problems lurk under the hood.

The app shows numerous errors when trying to send money even though I've been using zelle for years and have sent money to said person, every month. Yet, I have to try and process the payment probably 5+ times before it actually goes through. Always gives me an error and says contact my bank. EVENTUALLY, the payment will go through if I keep trying over and over again. This app truly sucks and they don't ever seem to release an update to fix the issue.

Update 03/31/21: I can not log in!!! The app acts like it is processing it but does nothing. Stays on the home page continuously. Very frustrating! I don't like my login info is not connected to my fingerprint or iris. I used to be able to access the app without inputting my password but now I can't. I understand the security measures but it should be my choice.

I you need to talk to a person, forget it. The automated system hangs up on your when you do not have a problem that fits its script. I have multiple accounts with one bank and some how my receiving account was changed to one that apparently cannot not receive funds because the tranaction status failed. I changed my profile back to the account to which I have received transfers via Zelle in the past. yet the transactions still says failed and no one at my bank, my client's bank or Zelle seems to be able to "see" the transaction to get it out of limbo. What good is technology if the people who promote it don't have access to it when there is a problem. Stick with Cash App, you have more control over your money even when it leaves your bank account.
